system.description:
You have supplemented your martial training with innovation—or was it the other way ‘round? You gain the following benefits:

  • Your Strength, Dexterity, or Intelligence score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with improvised weapons.
  • You gain proficiency with battle books. Your artificer schematic book can become a battle book if you desire.
  • Half your fighter levels count as artificer levels for the purpose of the Battlefield Smithing feature.
  • When you are making a spell invention for a spell of the Weaponry school, you can combine the spell invention with an appropriate weapon you have. (So if the spell requires a melee weapon attack, you could combine the spell invention with a melee weapon). The spell invention adds a pound of weight to the weapon, and if the weapon breaks, the spell invention fizzles. You count as wielding both the weapon and the spell invention at the same time, and the spell invention does not interfere with any magical properties the weapon has.
  • You gain proficiency with your choice of either the Grinding Cog combat tradition or Viper’s Fangs combat tradition and learn a maneuver from the selected tradition that you could learn. It does not count against your maneuvers known.
  • You gain the following feature: 
    Extra Attack
    At 5th level you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
system.prerequisite: 3 levels in artificer, 3 levels in fighter
